item.title: Emacs Shortcuts

item.title: Emacs Tramp
item.description: Tramp mode for sshing Emacs Tramp tricks C-x C-f /ssh:root@ssb.willschenk.com:/etc/host This command will ssh into it and now projects can be browsed into emacs as if it were right here on my local machine. C-x C-f also need not be done since I have bound it to Spc-Spc. C-x C-f /sudo::/etc/hosts : edit file as sudo Also has some tips for docker

item.title: Emacs Windows Installation
item.description: Problems with installing Not having msys2 so that pdftools can’t build [install msys] Not having mingw so that sqlite can’t build for org-roam [choco install mingw] Don’t even have to do that. The mingw is installed by msys2. So go to mysys2: there will be folder named mingw64. Add it’s bin to the PATH. pacman -Syu pacman -S base-devel pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-toolchain pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-zlib pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-libpng pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-poppler pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-imagemagick Then find a version that supports modules : emax64.

item.title: LISP
item.description: Major points to remember LET doesn’t let you refer to previous variables, so you need to use LET* for that. (progn do_this do_that) –> multiple things to do setting variables: (setq var-name value) Live Demo (write-line “single quote used, it inhibits evaluation”) (write ‘(* 2 3)) (write-line " “) (write-line “single quote not used, so expression evaluated”) (write (* 2 3)) require ‘elm –> way of loading a library

item.title: Org mode Tips and Tricks
item.description: Clone trees with time shifts: Bound to C-c C-x c, org-clone-subtree-with-time-shift create multiple subtrees with timestamps shifted. Useful for creating skeleton for repeated tasks. Spc-m-b-c : create table or update from region: use with whitespace mode if there is an issue. Advanced features (The Org Manual) Gives functionality to change formula, update on formula change, go directly to formula and so on. Also we can create org tables in html mode as well as latex mode.
